SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class SignatureMediator

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.SignatureMediator
public class SignatureMediator extends Object
This class acts as an intermediary between the main controller of the application and various signature controllers. It handles the setup and coordination of signature creation and verification processes across different operational modes, including standard, benchmarking, and comparison benchmarking. This class ensures the appropriate controllers are utilized and configured based on the operational context and mode.

  • Constructor Details

    • SignatureMediator

      public SignatureMediator(MainController mainController)
      Constructs a SignatureMediator with a reference to the main controller of the application. It initialises the standard and benchmarking mode controllers for signature verification or creation.
      Parameters:
      mainController - The main controller of the application, responsible for overall application flow.

  • Method Details

    • getSignatureControllerStandard

      public AbstractSignatureBaseController getSignatureControllerStandard()
      Returns the standard mode signature controller. This controller is responsible for managing signature creation or verification in standard mode.
      Returns:
      The standard mode signature controller.

    • getSignatureControllerBenchmarking

      public AbstractSignatureBaseControllerBenchmarking getSignatureControllerBenchmarking()
      Returns the benchmarking mode signature controller. This controller is responsible for managing signature creation or verification in benchmarking mode.
      Returns:
      The benchmarking mode signature controller.

    • getSignatureControllerComparisonBenchmarking

      public AbstractSignatureBaseControllerBenchmarking getSignatureControllerComparisonBenchmarking()
      Returns the comparison benchmarking mode signature controller. This controller is responsible for managing signature creation or verification in cross-parameter benchmarking mode.
      Returns:
      The cross parameter benchmarking mode signature controller.

    • setProvableKeyBatchForSignatureProcesses

      public void setProvableKeyBatchForSignatureProcesses(String keyBatch, boolean isKeyForComparisonMode, boolean isKeyForCustomComparisonMode)
      Sets the batch of private and public keys for a signature process. This method is crucial for handling the application's functionality in different modes, specifically in comparison and custom comparison benchmarking modes. It delegates the process of setting keys for the signature creation and verification controllers, allowing these controllers to operate with the specified keys.

      In comparison mode, this method helps in setting up the environment for comparing the standard vs provably secure parameters. In custom comparison mode, it facilitates a more granular and detailed analysis with arbitrary user provided key configurations.

      Parameters:
      keyBatch - The batch of keys used in the signature creation/verificaton process.
      isKeyForComparisonMode - Indicates if the keys are used in comparison mode, enabling performance comparison.
      isKeyForCustomComparisonMode - Indicates if the keys are set for custom comparison mode, enabling detailed analysis with custom configurations.

    • setProvableKeyForSignatureProcesses

      public void setProvableKeyForSignatureProcesses(String key)
      Sets the private/public key for signature verification/creation operations. This method is used to provide the signature controller with a provably secure generated (small e ) key pairing to allow for later instantiation of a signature scheme with provably secure parameters. The key pairing can be set in non-benchmarking mode.
      Parameters:
      key - string representation of the key to be preloaded for a signature process

    • setKeyConfigurationStringsForComparisonMode

      public void setKeyConfigurationStringsForComparisonMode(List<String> keyConfigurationStringsForComparisonMode)
      Sets the list of key configuration strings for comparison mode signature controller operation by providing configuration details of the keys used in the comparison benchmarking mode. The configuration strings represent different key configurations that are used to compare signature processes under different key settings.
      Parameters:
      keyConfigurationStringsForComparisonMode - A list of string representations of key configurations.

    • setKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMapForCustomComparisonMode

      public void setKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMapForCustomComparisonMode(Map<Integer,List<HashFunctionSelection>> keyConfigToHashFunctionsMap, int keyPerGroup)
      Sets the mapping of key configurations to hash functions for the custom comparison mode in signature creation or verification controller. This method allows for specifying different hash functions for each group of key configurations.
      Parameters:
      keyConfigToHashFunctionsMap - The map linking each key configuration group to its hash function selections.
      keyPerGroup - The number of keys per group, determining how many keys are processed together.

    • showSignatureViewStandard

      public void showSignatureViewStandard()
      Displays the signature view in standard mode. This method triggers the UI update to show the interface for signature operations in standard mode.

    • showSignatureViewComparisonBenchmarking

      public void showSignatureViewComparisonBenchmarking()
      Displays the signature view in standard mode. This method triggers the UI update to show the interface for signature operations in standard mode.

    • showSignatureViewBenchmarking

      public void showSignatureViewBenchmarking()
      Displays the signature view in benchmarking mode. This method triggers the UI update to show the interface for signature operations with performance benchmarking functionalities.

    • getIsSingleKeyProvablySecure

      public boolean getIsSingleKeyProvablySecure()
      Checks if the single key set in the standard controller is provably secure.
      Returns:
      True if the single key is provably secure, false otherwise.

    • getComparisonBenchmarkingImport

      public String getComparisonBenchmarkingImport()
      Retrieves the imported key batch used in comparison benchmarking mode. This method is essential for accessing the batch of keys that have been loaded for conducting performance comparisons across different cryptographic parameters. It's especially useful in scenarios where the signature creation or verification processes need to operate with a predefined set of keys to facilitate comparison across different key sizes and configurations.
      Returns:
      A String representation of the imported key batch for comparison benchmarking mode. Returns null if no key batch has been imported.
